fields.description:
h1. Story

Since the user can drill into "Calls" from the Custom Data Summary Report in STORY-4172, we need to offer the Business Object filters on the Calls Report for the user to toggle.

h2. Proposed Solution
h3. Refactor MultiSelectFilterContainer for new filter interaction
* Add filter interaction - (talk with David about plus button dropdown)
** Create simple select component for filter select interaction (use MultiSelectFilter component as guide)
** primary object filters (advertisers, campaigns, affiliates -- which of these is based on existing behavior today built in STORY-4222)
** business objects (if they exist for this account, all 10 (if set) should be available in the list)
*** can get business object values from customer_business_object_N column from cf_customer_business_object_dimensions table. (use highest version number for row, make sure naming is consistent). Alternatively we can run a customSummaryReport.
*** filter calls by business object values (pass in as an option to the report), want to prefix the partner_name of business object in url and then transform prefix in the report.
** Every time a new filter is created, it should be removed from the list of available filters in the other dropdowns (to avoid duplicates)
** Repurpose deselect all "( x )" shaped button inside MultiSelectFilter to remove the filter from the filter container
* Need to support existing drill in behavior from a summary report and have appropriate filters set
** currently done on client side by parsing the url
* Tests - MultiSelectFilterContainer, SelectFilter

h2. Planning Notes
* Filtering by business object


h2. Grooming notes
- The filters will require a change of the MultiSelectFilterContainer and MultiSelectFilter components to add the ability to add / new filters using the plus button
- MultiSelectFilterContainer currently does not re-render itself, will need to build in that functionality (see shouldComponentUpdate)

h2. UX Interactions
- The filters will no longer be static but must be added using the plus button.
 ** Need to support existing behavior of drilling in from a summary report and having multiple filters already shown & filter selections set
- Clicking on the plus button should spawn a single select dropdown showing the available filter types
- Once the item is selected, the dropdown should close, removed and in its place a MultiSelectFilter show up for the previously selected type, eg: advertisers, affiliates, campaigns, or any business object (aka "Source")
- Every time a new filter is created, it should be removed from the list of available filters in the other dropdowns (to avoid duplicates)
- The filters should wrap cleanly within the "filter bar" if user has added enough to run off the right edge
- Each MultiSelectFilter should have an "x" button that removes it and clears all its filters (refer to mockup).
- There will no longer be a deselect all "( x )" shaped button showing up inside the multiselectfilter next to the name. 

h2. How to Demo
# On an organization where Custom Data is enabled (backend flag), access the Custom Data Summary Report
# From the custom Data summary report, click on "Calls" to drill into the Calls Report
# Verify that when the Calls Report loads, we pre-filter the report by passing in the Business Object selection from the Summary Report: confirm that this populates in the appropriate Business Object filter in the filters bar of the Call Details Report
# Confirm that the number of Calls that are rendered in the Data Table match the selection made when drilling into Calls from the Custom Data Summary Report
# Show that you can add additional filters to the Business Object that is already being pre--filtered
# Show that you can clear the filters to redraw the data 
# Show a regression case of going to the "Overview" summary report as a network
## Click into the call count on a specific row
## Show that the details are shown with the 3 filters (advertiser, affiliate, campaign) visible and pre-filtered, and now with a plus button next to them
# create business object with a partner_name that matches an internal field name (ie: Advertiser_name), url should show something like 'custom_data_advertiser_name'

comments.body:
I think this item can be done as part of this

https://ringrevenue.atlassian.net/browse/TECH-1235

[~avillalobos] I updated the description to be a bit more specific on some items, and addressed the open items/questions you had for me.  I cleaned up the "proposed solution" section as that was out of date too.  Please re-review the description in its entirety and let me know if there are still questions for me / UX, thanks!
[~avillalobos][~nick] Is this story really blocked by TECH-1235 or is that just a nice to have?

I was thinking TECH-1235 was going to be a subtask of this story.  Technically doesn't block it and just a nice to have, but in what Alberto and I discussed, and how the breadcrumbs / report titles are generated currently it will be more difficult and error prone to generate the correct breadcrumbs when coming from custom reports that have user-specified dimensions.  Was hoping it would be a "while building custom report breadcrumbs, look for opportunities to more toward the refactored design".  

That said, [~drichmond] what do you have in mind for the breadcrumbs when coming from a custom report and you've drilled down on a call count where 2 business objects were chosen as dimensions (ie. "Source" & "Region"). Can you add examples please? Depending on the complexity, that would help answer how critical TECH-1235 is.

I see various options:
{code}
Easy (same in all cases but not very useful as a breadcrumb):
  Dashboard > Custom Summary Report > Call Details

Harder (dynamic based on what dimensions shown): 
  Dashboard > Custom Summary Report by Source > Call Details 
  Dashboard > Custom Summary Report by Source and Region > Call Details 
  Dashboard > Custom Summary Report by Source, Region, and Channel > Call Details 

Another idea (same complexity as above):
  Dashboard > Custom Summary Report > Source Report > Call Details 
  Dashboard > Custom Summary Report > Source and Region Report > Call Details 
  Dashboard > Custom Summary Report > Source, Region, and Channel Report > Call Details 
{code}

[~avillalobos] I backed out the mention of Signals from this story.  As discussed, it's covered in STORY-4379 and now in the custom summary dependency diagram https://docs.google.com/drawings/d/1klpJqRkfvPpHM4WH-V2sD0ot38UkEN2WVmcMuDufZJg/edit

cc: [~mweaver]

[~vcarrillo] My Notes:

# How to generate the filter type drop down contents
##	The server will generate the list of filters
##	The client side will remove the ones that have already been selected
# How does the report allow filtering by business objects?
##	Does it use customer_data_N names, or the user friendly names, or partner names? (Probably partner names)
##	What names should be put in the URL and/or send to the end point? Use partner names. Prefix them with something to prevent collisions with our names.
# How to populate select2 filters for business objects
##	Warehouse aggregate may have the values in a table already?
##	Worst case, we will need to run an aggregate report to get them on the fly. (Will be slow)
# Change interaction with +:
##	Click +, drop down appears below (or to right?) the +, rather than appearing to the left. Appearing on the left confuses the selecting of the filter type, with the selecting of the filter values.
